DataElement.preferredName: Lymphoma Therapeutic Procedure Administered Other Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term or abbreviation to represent another name of a pharmaceutical regimen containing two or more agents which are given together or separately to treat a patient with malignant lymphoma that was not already mentioned or specified.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites.  This category includes Non-Hodgkin's lymphomas and Hodgkin's lymphomas. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created and released for TCGA per request and approval by B. McClure-Shimel. mc 1/30/12

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.
